1111.content:
After her close friend and training partner left to go back home, Chie promised him that she would be strong enough to protect everyone. And while she had been putting on a brave face for all her friends, deep down she missed her friend. Without him she didn't even enjoy training anymore. So instead she spent most of her free time at home watching her kung fu flicks and snacking away. After school she'd go out for steak, even when nobody else came with her. It had only been two months since her friend left, but Chie had already put on twenty pounds.

Her other friends were really starting to worry about her, partly because she didn't even seem to notice that anything was wrong. She still acted like the same energetic tomboy she had always been when she was around them, so it was most likely that this gain was subconsious in nature. And she still wore the exact same clothes, only now her newly formed pudgy stomach was poking out underneath her green jacket and her skirt was getting really tight. But even with these changes to her wardrobe she didn't notice anything different about herself. She just kept saying her mom shrunk her clothes in the wash.

One day her friend Yukiko finally worked up the courage to talk to Chie about it and invited her to Junes for steak.

"Oh Yukiko you shouldn't have," said Chie as she waited at the table for their meal to be ready.
"It was my pleasure," she answered as she worried how much this was going to set her back.
"So, what did you want to talk to me about," asked Chie as she looked back to see if their food was ready.
"Oh, um, right." Yukiko wondered how she should aproach the subject. "Well, I just wanted to know how you've been."
"Me, I'm great. You know me, always ready for anything. I mean I got a little depressed yesterday because I tried on my summer uniform, seeing as how we'll have to break them out soon." Chie paused for a second to look back at the resteraunt counter again.
"Oh really," said Yukiko, wondering if Chie was about to say what she thought she was going to say.
"Yeah, and you won't believe it, but my mom shrunk that uniform too," said Chie as she dropped her head down, causing a small double chin to appear. Yukiko sighed, realizing she had assumed right. "I mean, seriously," said Chie, "the buttons would barely connect. I thought they were going to pop off."
"Right, um, well..." Yukiko decided this was the time to speak up.
"Ooh, steaks done," said Chie as she jumped up and ran over to the counter. Yukiko just sighed again. Chie quickly returned holding two trays, one with one steak for Yukiko, and the other with three steaks for herself.

What happened next?

Chie entered the school to find a large group of students standing around the bulletin board making quite a commotion. "What's going on," she asked a student.

"Apparantly there's some kind of a sign up for a new fighting club," he answered back.

Chie was struck silent by the news. For over a year she'd been trying to convince the school to open some kind of a fighting club and now it had finally happened. "Let me see, let me see," she said as she forced her way through. "What kind is it, karate, boxing, kendo?" She made it through the crowd and looked at the sheet on the wall with the announcement. "Sumo club?" she uttered as she read it. "What the, this isn't anything close to what I've been asking for."

"Sorry," said one of the students, "apparantly some of the teachers are big fans of the sport."

Chie huffed and puffed to herself while looking at the announcement. She knew she shouldn't have gotten her hopes up. "Well," she thought to herself, "I guess it is a legitimate fighting sport, plus if this club does really well, then maybe they'll add other sports." Chie hated the idea of joining the team, but if she ever wanted their school to have a real martial arts team she knew this one had to be a success. And the only way she could guaranty that would be if she joined.

She went to the try outs the next day and was handed her uniform. She went into the empty women's locker room and changed into the green sumo thong and tank top she had been given. As she looked herself over in the mirror she felt incredibly exposed and embarrassed. "They expect me to actually fight in this, the bikini Yosuke gave me was less revealing than this." She thought about leaving and going home, but she just kept repeating to herself, you're doing this so you can get a real martial arts team, you're doing this so you can get a real martial arts team.

She walked out of the locker room and stood in line with the rest of the students who were there to try out. She looked down the line and noticed that not only was she the only non-fat person there, she was also the only woman. The coach walked down the line, looking each student up and down until he got to Chie. "Um, are you sure you're suppose to be here," he asked.

"Yep, this is the sumo club right?" she answered back.

"Well yeah, it's just, well women compete in a different league than the men."

"Okay," she said not seeing where this was going.

The coach sighed and said, "Well, it's just that you're the only girl here. And we can't really have a team of just one person."

Chie was crushed, her only chance to get the teachers to start a legitimate fighting club and now it was gone. "Wait," she said as an idea popped into her head, "what if I can convince some other girls to join."

"Well sure, but we'd need at least three more of them before tomorrow's practice if we're going to register you as a team."

"Say no more," she said as she ran off to the locker room to change. The coach tried to speak to her, but when Chie put her mind to something, nothing could stop her.

And so she spent the rest of the day running all over the school and town trying to find every large female student from her school that she could. Unfortunately none of them wanted to join, no matter how much Chie begged them. In fact when she asked Hanako to join she barely escaped alive, apparantly it wasn't a good idea to tell Hanako she was fat to her face.

That night Chie sat at home wondering what she was going to do. She had to find three more girls before tomorrow or else she could kiss her dreams of the school adding more fighting teams goodbye. But Chie didn't know anymore big girls, in fact the only three other girls she hung out with were skinny. "Wait," she said, "I'm kind of thin and they're letting me join. Maybe they don't have to be fat to join the sumo team. And sure none of them are really skilled in hand to hand fighting, but I could train them." Chie knew what she had to do, the next day at school she had to ask her friends to join the team. But who should she ask first?

Yukiko was right, but Chie pretended to not mind it. "Oh, hey, are you kidding me? Any fighting team is a step in the right direction. In fact I, um, I sort of actually joined it yesterday."

Pick up the chopsticks and plow through the pain
113211111221112212122111.content:
Yukiko and Naoto sat on one side of the the booth at Aiya's Chinese Resteraunt while Rise and Chie sat on the other. Chie and Rise were ready for their meals to arrive and hadn't stopped talking since leaving practice, but Naoto and Yukiko hadn't said more than a few grumbles under their voices.

"I can't believe it's actually happening," said Chie to Rise, "we've got a complete team, you're going to be a superstar, all our goals are coming together." Rise and Chie continued laughing and talking, unaware that this comment caused Naoto and Yukiko to stare daggers into them from across the table.

While Rise and Chie continued talking, Yukiko whispered to Naoto, "Hey, Naoto-kun, you're not really going to go through with this are you? I mean, you've got some sort of way of getting out of this, right?"

Naoto sighed and reluctantly said, "I wish I could. But as soon as I signed that entrance sheet earlier today I gave my word that I would be a part of this team, and a detective is a person of honor who never goes back on their word. But you're in no such predicament, I would fully understand if you backed out."

Yukiko began to think about it when suddenly the waiter arrived at the table with their meals, eighteen bowls full of steaming hot meat. "What, what is all this," asked Yukiko, "we haven't even ordered yet."

"Oh I called ahead," said Chie as she took out her chopsticks, "I didn't want you guys to go ahead and worry about what to eat. I'm the captain after all, I should be taking care of these things." The waiter put six bowls in front of Chie, five in front of Naoto, four in front of Yukiko, and three in front of Rise. "See, I even ordered different amounts since we each have to be in different weight classes. So don't worry about a thing, I'll make sure that we hit our goal in time."

"B-b-but this is insane," said Yukiko as she stared at the large amount of food in front of them. There was so much steam coming off the bowls that she could hardly see Chie on the other side of the table. Even Rise went quiet as she marveled at all the food. "We only had coupons for for bowls at this resteraunt. We'll go broke from all this."

"Yukiko, didn't I say I had everything planned out," said Chie with a confident grin, "it's raining outside, right? And that means that today is Aiya's famous rainy day special. This is this biggest meal, and if we can finish it then it's free. So all we have to do is eat all of it, and anything that isn't eaten we can use the coupons on."

"Wow," said Rise feeling very unsure of the plan, "I guess you did think everything out sempai."

"This isn't humanly possible," said Naoto in a matter of fact tone, "the human body, especially ones as small as ours, cannot consume this much in one sitting."

"Hey," said Chie as she started shoveling food in her mouth, "we've only got two weeks until our first match, and we each have to gain a hundred pounds or more..."

"That also isn't humanly possible," interrupted Naoto.

"Not with an attitude like that," said Chie with meat sticking out of her mouth, "but am I the only person who's forgetting we've done stuff before that nobody thought possible. And besides, I refuse to let this team down, to look weak in front of the school, or to cause you guys embarrassment by losing."

Yukiko wanted to tell her that the only embarrassment she felt was over having to put on a hundred pounds and wear a sumo thong in front of people. But then she saw the burning determination in Chie's face as she shoveled meat into her mouth faster than a person should. "Um, Chie, you'll get sick if you eat that much, you should really slow down."

Chie looked up and smiled. "Don't worry Yukiko, I'm the captain. So if anybody has to get sick in order to meet our goals, it should be me." She then went back to eating.

Yukiko looked at Chie who clearly was one hundred percent focused on the task at hand. Next to her Rise was closing her eyes and slurping up the bowl in an attempt to eat as quickly as possible. Even Naoto was dining at a resonable pace, although she clearly wasn't enjoying herself. It was then that Yukiko realized that her best friend really did care about this, and that it was important to Rise as well. Even Naoto was taking it seriously, so maybe it was time to give up her lifelong diet. She picked up her chopsticks and dug in as well.

Hours passed as the rain kept pouring down outside. The girls had each gotten through about half of their individual meals when they hit a wall. Not even Chie could keep going. Their stomachs were clearly rounded and protruding, slightly lifting up the bottom of their shirts and forcing Naoto to even go up a notch on her belt. Chie looked at the three bowls left in front of her and couldn't believe she could only eat three of them. Granted she had never tried to eat more than one at a time, but she could always do that so easily so she figured six would be fine. Clearly she was wrong, it was like these bowls were gateways to the meat dimension. She looked around at all her friends who were each moaning and rubbing their stomachs. She realized what she had to do.
113211111221112212122111.title: Let the gaining, I mean, training begin

choices: Chie manages to finish the bowl... Onto the last one!
One of the other girls steals the last bowl! Chie looks like she'll explode!
1132111112211122121221112.content:
Slowly, Chie lifted up her chopsticks, reaching for one of the three remaining bowls that was left sitting in front of her. She wasn't one to give up in the past... And she wasn't going to start now!

GULP!

Naoto, Yukiko and Rise all watched as Chie continued to plow through the meaty ramen, not giving up. But just watching Chie gorge herself made the other three girls wince in pain since it reminded them of their own bloated stomachs.

The pain that racked Chie's stomach made her drop her chopsticks... But Chie wasn't going to give up! Lifting up the bowl she was working on, Chie placed the bowl to her lips and began to eat the meat straight from the bowl - Going straight through the pain and meat.

'This doesn't hurt! This doesn't hurt!' Chie thought as she continued to chew and swallow the gateway to the meat dimension. And so, with one bowl down, Chie turned her sites on the second to last bowl...

"Chie?" Yukiko groaned, her stomach killing her now as she watched Chie scarf down the second bowl of Ramen messily. "A-Are you sure that you... Urp!"

A blush crept on Yukiko's face - even that small burpr managed to make her stomach hurt too.

But Chie was too engrossed with the Ramen to really listen to her friends - It was her against the ramen now!

choices: Sponsor our team
Let us eat here once a day for free
11321111122111221212211122.content:
Chie put down the now empty bowl, panting as she felt her stomach about to explode. Her arm started to rise up, almost as if it was on autopilot, she wasn't even looking at where it was going. Slowly the hand reached for her final bowl when Yukiko swung in and grabbed it. "Chie, please, you look like you're about to pass out."

"Iodowanasto," muttered Chie, dazed from the pain. She shook her head and got her thoughts together. "I-I can keep going."

Naoto sighed, she had to admit to herself that for a brief moment she enjoyed seeing Chie go through this, seeing as how she got them into this. But deep down she was still her friend and nothing would ever change that. "Come on Chie, our captain has to take care of herself," said Naoto.

"N-Naoto," uttered Chie in disbelief. Che looked like she was about to cry and nodded, "Okay, okay." She leaned back and looked at the plates still on the table. Yukiko and Naoto both still had two bowls left, and Rise had about one and a half. She was amazed that they came this far, not even Kou or Daisuke from the sports teams could eat more than one bowl, but her friends were so dedicated they had eaten much more. She was about to compliment them on their work when she started doing the math in her head. "Hey, wait, we have four coupons for free bowls. If you guys can each finish one more bowl, then our entire meals will be for free."

The girls each looked at one another and then at their bowls. They were each about to burst, but she was right. Finishing two bowls was clearly impossible, but getting just one more bowl down was a goal that might be in reach. Each of the girls took deep breaths in ordrer to psyche themselves up. "Alright," said Rise, "let's go team." She sluggishly raised her hand as if trying to give a cheer. Even this knocked some wind out of her.

The three girls started cramming food into their already stuffed stomachs. It hurt, but they knew that if Chie could be this dedicated, then they had to be as well. Even Naoto was starting to get excited as she saw the finish line in reaching distance. Chie sat back, patting her stomach and watching her friends as a feeling of pride washed over her. It took another thirty minutes but the girls finally started to finish. Rise (having the smallest amount left) finished first and immediately fell over, resting her head on Chie's shoulder. Both of them were so full they didn't have the energy to move her out of the way.

Naoto was next, thanks to her understanding of proper eating methods and her determination, she was able to finish it without appearing to be in too much pain. "Wow Naotooo, yooo rlly mmm..." Rise couldn't bring herself to make any sense as she passed out.

"I think what she said is that was really cool, good job," said Chie. Naoto nodded to them without saying anything. She might have appeared calm on the outside, but in reality her mouth was still full of food that she couldn't swallow yet, and she secretly had to undue her belt, hoping nobody would notice for fear of embarrassing herself.

They turned to Yukiko who raised the final piece to her mouth, her hand shaking all the way. Chie could see that she needed help, so she worked up her strength and started cheering. "Yu-Ki-Ko, Yu-Ki-Ko, Yu-Ki-"

"You're not hoping that we join in on that are you," said Naoto as she tried to hide the food still in her mouth.

It might have been silly, but Yukiko actually did feel a burst of energy from this. She was able to put the final piece in her mouth and swallowed before falling back on the booth and letting out a huge sigh of relief. Chie wanted to applaud her friend and everyone else, but she just didn't have the energy. "Okay," said Naoto, "let's never do that again." Chie and Yukiko moaned in agreement.

"Aiya," shouted the owner of the store as he walked over to the table, "that was incredible. I've never seen anyone eat that much before. You girls are going up on our wall of fame."

Yukiko wanted to tell him not to do that, afraid someone she knew would see it, but she was too full to speak. "Cool," said Chie as she took a breath, "but could you do two more things for us?"

"Sure." he said with a nod.

"First," she said with a pant, "let us just sit here for one, two, maybe four hours. And secondly..."

The team was once again gathered inside Aiya. Naoto sighed and placed a hand on her hip. “I know one day’s overeating can only affect body fat so much, but I already feel rather bloated. I don’t know if I’m ready to surmount this dish, even after skipping lunch.”

Yukiko nodded. “I haven’t even eaten since yesterday. That may have been the most I’ve eaten in one meal in my entire life. I almost still feel full.”

Rise and Chie tilted their heads; the thought of preparation for what would clearly be an overwhelming and limit-pushing meal had never occurred to them. “Maybe I shouldn’t have gotten seconds earlier, now that I think about it…”

It had been a few months since Souji (the main character) had left Inaba, and things had returned to normal for the most part. Yukiko was busy with school and her friends, and she now had a new sense of determination to help out at the family inn. But now that she wasn't running around fighting Shadows anymore, she had a strange unsatisfied feeling inside her. It was like there was something she now wanted, something new that she couldn't quite put her finger on, something she hadn't noticed until now.

One rainy night she was doing homework when she saw it was getting close to midnight. The midnight channel hadn't aired since they solved the mystery a few months ago, but part of Yukiko missed waiting to see what would appear before her. "Oh, what the heck," she said as she decided to close the blinds and turn off the TV. "It might be fun to pretend for a few minutes." She stared into the TV knowing nothing would show up, but as the clock struck midnight a fuzzy image did start to appear. She could barely make it out, it almost looked like a large blob. The camera zoomed in on the figures face, and instantly she realized it was her. It was Yukiko, but incredibly fat.

"What, what was that," she wondered as the image faded away. "Was that me? But, the image is suppose to display our true feelings, so what was that suppose to mean?" She thought about calling her friends to go investigate, but if that really was her she couldn't bare the thought of them seeing her like that. They already saw her dressed like a fairy princess and saying she wanted to "score with guys," and that was humiliating enough.

The next day after school her friends wanted to hang out, but Yukiko blew right pass them, saying she already had plans. She headed to Junes by herself, put on her glasses, and jumped into the TV screen. She searched around inside the TV world, and it didn't take her long to find what she was looking for. She saw before her a giant castle designed to look like a cake and made entirely out of sweets. "Oh great," she said feeling embarrased even though no one was around, "again with the fairy tale stuff."

She ran into the castle and hurried to the top. She saw a few shadows, but they were all fat and slow so she was able to breeze right pass them. She reached the top of the castle and walked into a giant dining hall. Standing before her was the figure from the screen. It was her alright, she was even wearing Yukiko's red uniform, plaid skirt, and black leggings. But there was one huge difference, this shadow version of her was three hundred pounds heavier. All of her clothes were stretched so far they looked like they were going to burst, and her stomach poured out under her shirt and over her skirt.

"Who, who are you," asked Yukiko.
"Me," said the glowing eyed version of herself, "I'm you, isn't it obvious? Or did my beautiful figure confuse you?"
"What are you talking about" shouted Yukiko. "You're not beautiful, you're, you're, you're a cow."
The shadow laughed, causing her double chins to shake. "But isn't that what you want. I know what you long for, what you've been craving. You're always trying to watch your figure, and you hate it. You just want to let go and eat whatever you want."
"No, that's not true," said a panicked Yukiko.
"Oh just think about it. You've already been down this road once before. You know we shadows tell the truth about how you really feel. And you know what happens if you deny us."
Yukiko knew the shadow was right, they did only reveal the truth about people. But this still just couldn't be true. This had to be some kind of a trick by someone. Yukiko wondered what she should say.

Yukiko Amagi and Chie Satonaka were never seen again.

Their families mourned them, while trying to desperately cling onto the belief that they were still out there, somewhere. Their friends searched the midnight channel thoroughly for any signs of them, but even Rise couldn't pick them up with her scanning abilities. Rumours were rife that the two girls had been killed like poor Saki Konishi, despite their killer having been found and bought to justice. As time passed, gradually the small town moved on from the horrific summer that had taken a few of their own from them, and the girls faded to nothing more than a memory.

Yosuke eventually took over as manager of Junes, following his father's footsteps, and one of his first ports of call was installing a fountain in memory of those who had died that summer. He took a wife for himself, and began helping Inaba restore some of the beloved shopping district, working alongside the old stall owners to ensure that Junes could help their business, rather than hurt it. With time the shopping district began to bloom again, under the watchful eye of Junes, and Inaba went from strength to strength.

Kanji and Naoto ended up getting married one beautiful spring morning, and settled down in Inaba. Naoto continued her detective work, showing the world that not all of the greats needed to be male, and went on to found her own agency. Kanji learned to embrace his softer side, and took care of their children, all the while running workshops to help people learn the basics of sewing and darning. He took over the textiles shop after the death of his mother.

Rise went back to fame, but with a stronger set of shoulders to help her cope with it. She included her missing friends in her songs, and dedicated as many of her concerts as she could to their memory. Time went by, and she decided to turn her talent to acting, a lifestyle that gave her the chance to have a life outside of her work. She married a certain Souji Seta in her early twenties, and named their first child Chie. Souji remained in Inaba to help out Yosuke now and again, a part of him tempted to jump back into the TV, and continue the search for their friends.

Deep in the bowels of the television world, a candy castle went unnoticed. It's occupants were two massively fat girls, who spent their days eating and growing. Their bodies no longer resembled anything human, just massive blobs of flesh that were packed with fat. Chie and Yukiko only knew eating and growing fatter and fatter. Their supply of food was endless, the castle would expand every now and again to contain their massive bodies.

Sometimes while waiting for the next mouthful of candy, their thoughts would drift to home. Then they would be forgotten with the sweet taste that flooded their mouths, and they would continue eating.

In general, Inaba had been mostly peaceful for the past month or so. No murders, no fog, nothing to bother the teenagers that had gotten to the bottom of the mystery that had struck in Inaba. With nothing much to do, each of them had soon gone to other matters.

Yu Narukami (Or the protagonist if you didn't know his name.) had since moved away from Inaba, going out into other parts of Japan to pursue new things. While he didn't specifically say what he planned to do, the others were for the most part on board with his decision and so he made his leave.

Love had also managed to bloom between some of them, the most clear and obvious being between Yosuke Hanamura and Chie Satonaka. The boy and girl had been going to out with each other for a month now, and for the most part, it was a fairly stable relationship. Yosuke would sometimes end up being a punching bag for Chie, and other times he would need to take care of a bill that Chie would have racked up if she had let her passion for steak get to her. Despite this, the two had clear feelings for each other and it was good enough to keep their relationship going.

There had also been some goings on with Kanji Tatsumi and Naoto Shirogane, both of them beginning to spend more time with each other. It had started off slow, with Kanji confessing his love in the most awkward and stretched out ways until he finally got it out, a very strange sight to see if you managed to catch a glimpse of it. Naoto was okay to oblige, though it was unsure if she actually felt happy. The couple had tried to get some romance started, going to the usual settings that made for romantic moments. After a while, the two had warmed up to the idea of them being together.

Coming down the street on the way back from school, the figures of Yukiko Amagi and Rise Kujikawa could be seen. It was quite strange to note that the two lovely ladies had been unable to get boyfriends in the past months. Neither of them seemed to care too much for the matter, the two merely happy that things had settled down so they could relax a little. They spent a lot of time together, generally being good friends when it came to most things. Even at school, they found themselves working together in most occasions. As they walked, Yukiko turned to Rise and asked her a question.

"You haven't heard from Teddie recently, have you? I haven't seen him in a while."

Rise also turned and replied. "I've seen him a few times, but not really spoke to him. He spends so much time in his human form these days, always ogling girls in stores. He'll go into them just to chat them up sometimes!"

Yukiko laughed a little. "At least he hasn't changed a bit."

"There's something going on behind that wall, it doesn't sound pretty." Yukiko told her.

"Yeah, but should we be really getting involved into it? It isn't like it matters to us, even if it is a bad thing."

152131.content:
Ai Ebihara, the self proclaimed Queen of Yasogami had finished a power shopping trip, even though she stated she'd go back to herself a bit more, she didn't mind having nice things after all, she opened up her umbrella to cover herself from the rain. Two bags in one hand and two wrapped around her arm as she checked the time, 2:55. "I'm sure my folks wouldn't mind if I got a snack before I come home."

Ai had a bit of trouble deciding where to eat but since it was raining she'd go for the Rainy Day Special she heard about at Aiya. Later at the Aiya Chinese Diner Ai walked in. "Excuse me can I see about getting the Rainy Day Special?"

A few people recognized the voice and were shocked that Ai of all people would order the Rainy Day Special. "Coming right up miss!"

A Yasogami student walked up. "Queen Ebihara?"

"Yes?" She looked at the student being nice and polite.

"You DO realize what the Rainy Say special is right?" He asked.

"Is it bad? I never tried it before..."

"No well...it's kind of a challenge that the owner had, and so far only Hanako and Souja-senpai have ever completed it."

"Uh-oh..." Ai said.

Before she could recall her order the Massive Bowl to the Meat Dimension was before her. "Um sir I'm sorry I didn't realize what this was can you perhaps take it back?"

"Sorry miss, standard policy, if you don't eat it 3000 Yen But if you ca eat it you get no charge." The owner said.

"3000!?" Ai quickly checked her purse, she only had 2,400 left and she stopped using cards to limit herself.

"What if I can't pay?" Ai asked.

"Then you work off your debt for about two weeks." The Owner said, Ai looked at it, she felt it, the massive wave of meat that sat in that bowl, an entire cow and a half of meat at least.

Ai didn't want to work off the debt, she knew nothing of working, there was only one option. Taking a deep breath she concentrated, seeking her inner fat self the Piggy-Hara that had been locked away for years. "I'll do it."

Unknowingly to Ai the Hunger she quelled with her new-found will she had made years prior had grown, it was a bestial hunger at this point. "Whoa...Ai's a machine!"

The hungry belly roared as if it was the Constellation Leo, a roar that could echo through the sky, it was such a massive roar of a stomach that some of the people grew a bit hungrier themselves. "This bowl, as I dig deeper I grow more satisfied! I love it!"

She dropped the chopsticks into the empty bowl, a pinch of flesh between her skirt and top. "Finished!"

The Owner was in shock and so was the Yasogami students, Ai Ebihara had not only finished the Rainy Day Special, but in record time! "Thank you for the meal!"

Ai walked out, she looked at her phone again 3:10 "Wow I ate faster then I thought. Oh...but I..."

Ai suddenly doubled over in pain as a roar echoed through the rain, a passing couple stopped. "Honey I feel hungry, can we grab a bite to eat?"

"Sure." The man said.

Ai stood up shaking her head. "I'm...so hungry...it feel like my entire stomach is going to collapse into itself if I don't get food. Am I...returning to my old self, truly? Am I becoming....Piggy-Hara?"

Ai walked down the road to the General Store, she had a hankering for some doughnuts and knew since it was a rainy day that the store owner would give her usual discounts. Walking inside she saw a familiar face, her 'rival' Yukiko Amagi, but that didn't matter to her anymore, she didn't want to be a 'perfect' girl, right now all she wanted was some food for her hungry stomach. "Hmmm."

Ai passed the candy section, too many small treats that wouldn't fill her, and looked at the selection. "May I help you with something?"

Ai looked to the store owner, she pulled out 2000 of her 2400 Yen. "I'd like as many doughnuts as this can buy."

The shop lady took the money. "Right away miss."

Ai tapped her finger, looking to Yukiko. "Hello there Yukiko."

The dark haired girl looked to Ai. "Oh.Hello, do I...know you?"

"Huh? You must not if you're asking, Ai Ebihara, we both go to Yasogami, you and me are pretty much the most popular and attractive girls in the school." Ai said.

"Oh, I really don't involve myself with that." Yukiko said.

"Neither do I anymore." Ai said giggling, she liked striking up a conversation with someone who some time ago she wouldn't mind putting down.

Ai's stomach growled. "So Yukiko, what brings you here?"

"Oh just needed to buy some first aid kits for the inn, we're starting a new policy to..." Yukiko put a hand to her stomach, feeling a bit hungry herself.

"Oh sorry, little hungry, but we're trying to put first aid kits in each room in case of emergencies." Yukiko said.

"Oh that's good, hopefully people won't need it." Ai giggled.

"Yeah I'd rather the inn stay a safe place." Yukiko said, she and Ai were striking a conversation up not realizing Ai's hungry stomach was making Yukiko hungry too.

"Here you go miss, hope you can finish these all before they go bad." The Owner gave Ai five boxes as on rainy days a whole box costs 400 Yen.

"Oh thank you, well Yukiko it was nice getting a chance to talk to you."

"Oh, if it's not too much trouble, can I have one...or two...or a box?" Yukiko asked.

Ai looked at Yukiko, she saw something, the beauty everyone praises her for, why Yukiko was considered her rival. She also saw a hungry person whose stomach was growling, she handed Yukiko and box and the two of them walked out. "Thank you."

"It's no problem Yukiko." Ai said chomping down on a doughnut whole.

As Yukiko was about to leave Ai felt compelled to say. "Hey..."

Yukiko turned around facing Ai. "Want to...hang our tomorrow after school?"

"Um sure!" Yukiko said a bit taken back but somewhat happy.

Ai nodded with a smile. "We'll meet at the shoe lockers okay?"

"Sure, thanks again for the doughnuts!" Yukiko walked away, becoming hard to see through the rain after only a few seconds, Ai ate her doughnuts quickly and getting crumbs all over, licking her fingers at binging on four box of doughnuts. "Man that tasted good! Oh, I better get back home."

Ai headed for home to rest up and prepare for her meeting with Yuki, but the question in the back of her head though was, 'Why?'

Ai walked into her room to put her things she bought away, thinking about Yukiko still. "I've never really talked to her now that I think about it, I was always so mean before I thought of her as an enemy. Just how conceited was I?"

Before she finished she was called down for dinner, which was good because she was still hungry. Ai walked downstairs and sat down, the food was all ready. It was a meal of Pasta and Salad, a healthy meal for a healthy girl. She and her parents ate like normal but Ai was still very hungry but she didn't want to look like a ravenous beast in front of her parents, she realized that ever since her father got rich they all had changed, so they might not except the slowly returning fat daughter. "H-Huh?" Ai was stunned, but didn't realize she had done the one-two without even realizing it.

"Ai dear your plate is almost empty, would you like seconds too?" Ai looked down and saw how small her remaining food was and lightly nodded.

The Night past as Ai went back to her room, she took her clothes off save her bra and panties and examined the damage the beef bowl did, sure enough a mound of pudge went over her panties. Ai pinched it she gained about 10 pounds today, but something wasn't right Ai who had worked so hard for the body she had wasn't scared or angry. "This soft feeling, I forgot how soft my fat was. I was so fixated on making new friends and getting guys to like me, I forgot the simple pleasures of life."

Ai let go, took a shower and went to bed, slowly dozing off and having dreams of food. The next morning Ai woke up really early, around 5:27 to be exact, after getting ready Ai wanted to eat a big breakfast to quell her monstrous hunger. Four Slices of french toast, two waffles and a glass of orange juice later Ai was heading towards Yasogami. Ai spent her day doing her usual thing of trying to pay attention, and succeeded as the teacher's weren't being as boring as usual, but Ai for some reason was excited to meet Yukiko. "Just a little bit more..."

After the last bell Ai went to her shoe locker and got ready, Yukiko came down having said goodbye to her friends an telling them they're going somewhere. "Hey Yukiko."

"Hey Ai, hope I didn't keep you waiting." Yukiko said with a smile.

Two male students walked up and stood before each girl before putting bags of cookies in each girl's hand before running off. "Hey!"

The girls looked at the cards, both guys were fans of the girls. "Guess they never got to our shoe lockers. It's okay Yuki."

"But I'm not that kind of girl, I can't be bought with food." Yukiko said eating a cookie along with Ai, both were halfway done the bag and didn't even notice.

"Hey man check it out, It's Queen Ebihara and Yukiko Amagi." One male student said.

"Both of them, together? No Way man it's like a dream, just seeing those two side by side is like seeing a movie where the two most famous action stars fight each other."

"Na man that's just stupid, this is real life and they're not some sweaty over the hill actors. Hey...if they get closer to one another." The male student suggested.

"Oh man, that would be the greatest thing ever!" The other student chuckled pervertedly.

"Come on Yukiko, let's go somewhere." Ai said.

"Oh, okay but where?" Yukiko asked.

"I dunno, but I brought enough money so don't be picky." Ai said.

"Hmmmm" Yukiko pondered.

Yukiko has to pick they place she and Ai will eat, and her hungry stomach wanted big portions.

1522321.content:
Dieting was a pain when it came down to it. Ai sighed as she tried to ward off her stomach pains by taking a walk along the upper floors of the school, rubbing her side to try and make the ache go away. She had been shocked to discover she had gained a couple of pounds, and terrified of becoming Piggy-hara again, she had decided to accidentally forget her lunch that day. Ai's reasoning was that if she didn't have any food or much money, she wouldn't be tempted to buy anything.

Unfortunately she hadn't counted on being so unbelievably hungry. She stopped outside of a classroom with a groan, just happening to glance inside. One idiot student had left their bag on their desk, Ai noted, before a sudden realisation hit her. That could have meant they hadn't returned to the classroom before lunch had began. Which meant that there could be food in there that Ai could help herself too. Smirking a little, the slender girl looked up and down the hallway to check for anyone who might have been watching, before she slid open the door, and slipped into the room.

"Better be something good," Ai muttered to herself as she rummaged through the back, noticing with some disappointment that there was neither a bento box or any money in the contents, "Ugh! What kind of moron doesn't even have food?" she complained, clearly not beginning to think that she would belong in that category. She was about to give up and cut her losses when she felt something soft and squidgy at the corner of the bag. She pulled it out, and looked in wonder at the little blue sweet.

"... huh. Better than nothing," Ai decided, and popped the sweet into her mouth without a second thought. It tasted sweet, but a little musty, as if it had been in the bag for some time. Ai pulled a slight face as she swallowed it, surprised at how full she felt from just the one sweet. It was better than nothing, she quickly decided, and moved to rearrange the student's bag so that no-one would notice it had been rummaged through.

Curious to find out exactly what she had eaten, Ai quickly followed the two friends outside of the school. Fortunately the sidewalks were still crowded with students, so it wasn't all that hard to follow them without being noticed. She barged her way past her fellow students, her gaze firmly up ahead on Chie and Yukiko. Gradually the students thinned out, and Ai had to keep a little further back from them than she would have liked. She was starting to get hot and irritated when she saw that they were heading to Junes, and allowed herself to slow down a little to try and cool off.

"Whatever that 'water gem' was, it must have made my stomach like this," Ai noted bitterly as she looked down at her swollen midsection, stamping a foot on seeing that it had bloated out a little more, the gaps between her buttons had increased, showing the flawless pale skin underneath. Her blouse was starting to get a little uncomfortably tight, Ai, was tempted to try and pull it down, but she didn't want to risk a button popping off. Instead she continued to follow Chie and Yukiko, and immediately felt a little better for entering the air conditioned Junes.

"Trust them," Ai sighed on seeing the two were heading towards the food court, "That Chie is such a pig. I don't get how she stays so small." She hated the smaller girl. Not only could Chie eat her own weight in meat and not show a pound for it, Kou, Ai's precious Kou, actually had a crush on the tom boy. It disgusted Ai if she were honest, how dare he like someone like her, and ignore Ai completely? Ai was gorgeous, Chie was nothing on her. Her anger growing, Ai followed the two through to the food court, gasping in surprise on seeing the number of familiar students gathered about a table.

They made for an odd group of friends, Ai noted with a roll of her light brown eyes, but they were annoyingly close. There was Yukiko and Chie, who had just joined the group with a smattering of hellos and various greetings. There was Yosuke, who was an annoying little idiot who's father happened to run that branch of Junes. There was Kanji, the no good thug, and there was Naoto, the strange young girl who had posed as a man of all things. The thought made Ai wrinkle her nose, Naoto was just strange. Then there was Rise, a pop idol who somehow deemed those idiots as being worthy of her attention, and then there was Teddie, the strange newcomer who was an enviously pretty boy.

Then there was Souji. Ai hissed a sigh of frustration between her teeth on seeing Chie sit next to her Souji, and seeing the silver haired youth wrap his hand about her unfairly small waist. Ai gazed down at herself, at her bloated stomach that stood out so clearly against her thin frame; she knew if she wasn't so feared at school, a lot more students would have pointed it out to her. She rubbed a hand over it as she leant up close to a pillar to listen in on the group.

"Don't worry about losing that water gem," Souji spoke quietly to Chie, "We can find some more." He spoke little, but when he did, his words were wise and calculated; it was unfair that his gentle words were wasted on a dolt like Chie. Chie smiled in relief, and nuzzled up closer to her boyfriend.

"Still.. we can go in and try and find some?" Chie suggested, "I'm always up for more training." There was a collective series of nods, and Yosuke stood up from the table first, his chair legs scraping against the concrete floor.

"Okay then. I think the electronics department is empty enough," he decided, a hand to his chin, "Let's go!" With that the rest of the group got to their feet, and began heading out of the food court again. Ai frowned a little as she watched them leave. What did the electronics department have to do with anything?

152232122112.content:
"What the hell..?" Ai murmured as she got to her feet, groaning a little at how bloated her stomach still felt, "Where is this place?" She looked up at the building that appeared to be a gym, it looked somewhat like the one back at her old town, that she had used religiously throughout the summer to slim down. But there was differences, Ai noted, just slight adjustments here and there. For one the double doors had been replaced by a glowing red rectangle, with lines of black swirling slowly inside.

"This is weird," Ai sighed to herself as she looked around. She was surrounded completely in darkness asides from the gym ahead of her, and it was for that reason she began walking up the steps that led to the strange door. She stepped into the light with a shudder, it felt as if her entire body was trembling, only to walk out into the lobby of the gym as if nothing was out of the ordinary.

Ai looked around at the lobby, it looked just as she had remembered it. The reception desk was unmanned, and it was almost deadly silent, but it still looked the same. Her footsteps echoed as she walked across the tiled floor, her eyes darting around to drink in whatever she could see. She couldn't even begin to try and understand what was going on, her best bet was that she had somehow gotten knocked out. Maybe if she was lucky she had fallen asleep in class, and this was all a bad dream.

"Oh.." Ai stopped with a gasp as pain shot across her bloated stomach, she reached down to hold it, crying out as a button popped clear from her blouse, "Damnit!" She looked down at the gap her stomach was now protruding through. It was almost completely round, and very taut, Ai poked it reluctantly, not only was there no give, it was cool to the touch. She was starting to get extremely annoyed by her bloated stomach, her hatred towards Chie growing.

The apartment building was in a nice area of the city, close to the theatre Yumi worked at to pay for the rent, and the apartment itself was just perfect for her. It was a one bedroom affair, with a large living room, cosy kitchen, and an almost luxurious bathroom that Yumi had fallen in love with at first sight.

Yumi knew she was lucky, and every Sunday morning she went to the nearby shrine without fail, to pray to her father in gratitude. She was taking good care of her first apartment, the young twenty two year old had always been neat and tidy even as a child, and it was starting to feel a little bit more like home with every box she unpacked. Yumi smiled as she looked about her living room, giving a slight nod on seeing that it was finally complete. It was finally hers.

Yumi had grown just a little taller over the years, and she was still just as thin. Her narrow face was complimented by her cropped dark hair that fell just past her chin, and helped to soften the harsh angles a little. She was pretty, though many had stated that she would have looked good with a few extra pounds on her tiny frame. Still, she was an actress, and to be noticed, Yumi knew she had to remain thin in order to portray a certain image. It was fortunate for her that being thin was easy, she struggled to gain weight.

"Mmm?" Yumi glanced down at her phone as she passed it, noticing that a red light was blinking, "Oh.. I've got a message?" It must have rang when she was in the shower, she realised, and she hit a button as she turned to begin straightening out the cushions on the couch. There was a beep, followed by the standard electronic voice, before the message finally came through.

"Yumi, sweetheart? It's Rochelle," Yumi stiffened slightly, it was her agent, "You've been offered the starring role in a play, honey! It's Madame Butterball, I know, the Madame Butterball! I don't think I've ever had one of my girls get a role this juicy so quickly! Anyway, they're really happy with what they've seen so far! But.. uhh. Well, the thing is dear, that you need to look a little more like the esteemed Madame Butterball. You're far too thin. The director is gonna email you with the specifics, honey. Call me!"

Yumi found herself gazing at the now silent answering machine with wide eyes. She had been offered the role of the Madame Butterball? The most fought after role in theatre to date? She felt herself go a little dizzy, and she had to hold onto the back of the couch for support. A wide smile tugged over her thin lips, and she gave a little dance for joy. Sure there was the whole issue of being too thin, Yumi realised absently, but surely there was ways around that? She sat on her couch, pulling her laptop open and quickly logged into her emails.

Miss Yumi Ozawa

Congratulations! I would be honoured for you to star in my production of 'Madame Butterball' as the good Madam herself! You have the perfect voice and star quality to do the character justice. My only issue that is you are so small. Tradition dictates that Madame Butterball must be at least 250lbs in size.

My offer is this. If you can reach at least 200lbs before opening night in three months time, I will double your pay.

Or you can wear a fat suit to play the part.

I leave it open to you!

- Lars Mentou
